name: Kick-Off: Kotlin Coroutines + Tensorflow
description:
We'll start our first "Rhein-Neckar Dev Meetup" with two exciting talks in the beautiful Stocard office.

Rough Schedule:

## 18:30 - 18:45 Get together & Beer

## Talk 1: Asynchonous programming with Kotlin and Coroutines (Tobias Sch√ºrg)

## Pizza

## Talk 2: Tensorflowing like a pro - without a clue (Florian Barth)
- Short introduction to Machine Learning, Neural Networks, and Tensorflow
- Walkthrough: Retraining a Neural Network to identify loyalty card providers

We are looking forward to having a nice evening together.

Everyone is welcome!

---
If you're interested in sharing some of your projects, experiences or are interested in a specific topic, reach out at any time!

name: Meetup #2: Blog Promotion + Using Terraform to deploy Docker Services on AWS
description:
After the great start, we want to continue having inspiring talks and knowledge exchange.

## [Talk 1] The step by step guide to promote your tech article and blog. (Olga Kostova)

When you wrote a tech article or started a blog you want to share your knowledge and findings with the whole tech world but most often end up sharing it with your friends and family members. This talk is a guided step by step instruction on how to make your tech article “visible” to a broader audience.

## [Talk 2] Using Terraform to deploy Docker Services on AWS (Manuel Vogel)

- Introduction to Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform
- How to evolve your Infrastructure with Terraform
- Walkthrough: setting up your Swarms and deploy Docker Services

You also want to share anything? Found something interesting lately? Or discovered anything new you want to share, please let us know. Can be both, a few minutes introduction or an one hour deep dive.

name: Google I/O Keynote Streaming Party
description:
Oh yes, it's that time of the year! Google I/O 18 is around the corner and as everything is better with friends, we will be streaming the keynote together :)

The keynote stream will start on May 8th 19:00.

Be prepared for:
* Drinks & Pizza
* Keynote-Bingo
* Guess the Name: Android P
* and more ...

How to get to us:
* Location is at https://goo.gl/maps/mpavCDz8jvx
* Train: Mannheim Main Station -> Bus 60 -> Stop "Teufelsbr√ºcke"
* Tram: Tram #2 -> Stop "Dalbergstra√üe" -> little stroll through Jungbusch
* Car: Here (https://goo.gl/maps/TV8xgutnhLn) is a parking lot - parking ninjas tell stories of "Werftstra√üe" where you can find some non-residential, free parking spots.

name: Hackschool: Modern Android Development
description:
Welcome to September's Meetup! In this Hackschool we're sneak peeking into Modern Android Development. Come over and explore with Tobias and Andreas how Android Apps are developed nowadays and what the future holds.

17:45 Get together
18:00 Start
Pizza üçï + Beer üç∫ provided :)

Workshop: Modern Android Development (in 2018)
Language: English
Speakers: Tobias and Andreas, Stocard GmbH

How to get to us:
* Location is at Hafenstra√üe 25 - 27 Stocard offices https://goo.gl/maps/jxitY2H9BBw (5th floor)
* Train: Mannheim Main Station -> Bus 60 -> Stop "Teufelsbr√ºcke"
* Tram: Tram #2 -> Stop "Dalbergstra√üe" -> little stroll through Jungbusch
* Car: Here (https://goo.gl/maps/TV8xgutnhLn) is a parking lot - parking ninjas tell stories of "Werftstra√üe" where you can find some non-residential, free parking spots.

After the tour you will have an idea of...
...how the development of android apps changed in the last years
...why and how you should use Kotlin
...the recommended toolset to build modern apps
...the libraries modern apps utilize

What do you need?
In order to enjoy the tour to its fullest, please come equipped with a laptop (!!!) and a recent install of...
Android Studio (https://developer.android.com/studio/)
git (https://git-scm.com/downloads)

Sign-up?
https://www.meetup.com/Hackschool-Rhein-Neckar/events/254353845/
Many thanks @ Hackerstolz!
